alert.note: Alert for Mobile Coastal (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 8:09PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Mobile County through 900 PM CDT... At 807 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southwest of Magnolia Springs, or 8 miles southeast of Point Clear, moving southwest at 20 mph. This storm will affect areas around southwestern Mobile county, including Dauphin Island by around 9 PM. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bayou La Batre and Coden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
